text.__SUMMARY__:
Blyth's rosefinch (Carpodacus grandis) or the Himalayan rosefinch, is a species of finch in the Fringillidae family.  It is found in northern Afghanistan to the western Himalayas.  Its natural habitats are temperate forests and boreal shrubland.  It is sometimes considered a subspecies of the red-mantled rosefinch.
The common name commemorates Edward Blyth (1810–1873), English zoologist and Curator of the Museum of the Asiatic Society of Bengal.
text.References: Clements, J. F., T. S. Schulenberg, M. J. Iliff, B.L. Sullivan, C. L. Wood, and D. Roberson. 2012. The eBird/Clements checklist of birds of the world: Version 6.7. Downloaded from [1]
